question: You should spend about 20 minutes on this task.Write about the following topic.Some people believe that teaching children at home is best for a child's development while others think that it is important for children to go to school.Discuss the advantages of both methods and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
text: Several people commented that school training is the most relevant for youngsters mental improvement. However, others argue that  homeschooling is  the way to follow up. In my opinion,  the first view is the  most pivotal owing to the fact that  formal institutions are the right place to acquire  scientific knowledge. Although  self-centred learning produces  better results. This essay will shed light on both sides of the matter and provide evidence to prove the arguments.

On the one hand, legal schools education is the best place to get  scientific knowledge. In other words,  the pupil's development in  terms of  scientific skills commences at schools. Reading, listen and   formal speaking are learned  quickly and efficiently  with  experts in the field such as teachers and lecturers. For instance, a student  can learn  how  to peak and read fluently from the comfort of his home,  that said he will  face a challenger to  make a formal speech publicly. ​Moreover, a professor  will still be needed to guide him to apply sophisticated vocabulary.  As a result, sophomores reach their personal best and enhance their abilities and capabilities in a wide range of ways.

On the other hand,  household schooling  produces the best results.  The former method is regarded as the best way out  to instil a swift mental development because youngsters learn swiftly, and unfearless. Let's take  Ronaldo as an example, he became skilled in football due to  without an expert.    However,  he undoubtedly became one of the best gamers ever. For this reason,  this lecturing methodology is  deemed  more beneficial for several individuals.

In conclusion,  in spite of the overwhelming majority of people considering  home learning as  crucial for teenagers mental advancement, I still regard  school  as the  best way out for them. Therefore, I will support this stance always.
